term.longtitle: IUPAC Gold Book - velocity in mass transport
term.title: velocity

item.text: The flux density N B is related to the velocity by the equation N B = c B v B is the macroscopic average velocity at which the species B moves (which is to be distinguished from the random molecular velocity); cB is the concentration of species B (mol m-3). Note that the velocity is defined with respect to a frame of reference.

item.alttext: N B = c B v B

sources.item: PAC, 1981, 53, 1827. 'Nomenclature for transport phenomena in electrolytic systems' on page 1830 (https://doi.org/10.1351/pac198153101827)
